snippet: Drawing on lessons from the wars in Afghanistan and Iraq, the American military has established outposts to join Honduran forces against narcotics barons who use the country as a cocaine transit hub.
abstract: United States military, drawing on lessons from the wars in Afghanistan and Iraq, has established outposts in Honduras to interdict smugglers moving cocaine toward the United States from South America; mission has attracted little public notice but is being conducted with the support of the Honduran government.
lead_paragraph: Drawing on lessons from the wars in Afghanistan and Iraq, the American military has established outposts to join Honduran forces against narcotics barons who use the country as a cocaine transit hub.

headline.seo: U.S. Turns Its Focus on Drug Smuggling in Honduras
headline.main: Lessons of Iraq Help U.S. Fight a Drug War in Honduras
headline.print_headline: A U.S. Drug War Inside Honduras, Waged Iraq-Style

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
